content.description: This routes looks easy from the ground. It is not.  What appears to be a featured and not-so-steep undertaking is actually a series of hard mantles followed by a technical and footwork intensive crux.  The movement is excellent and varied, as is the the position.  Very well bolted.
content.protection: 5 bolts and rappel anchors.  A #4 or #5 camalot is comforting but probably unnecessary for the entry moves.
content.location: Faces the parking lot on the Solo Boulder. Located on the blunt arete closest to the Split Rocks.  Space Lichen is easily recognizable by the large, horizontal flake which cleaves the bottom of the route.  Begin by traversing the flake and standing on it to clip the first bolt.

content.description:
There are large detatched flakes on the overhanging East face of the Acid boulder.   A Bouldery (V4) start gets you to the jug flake, which takes pro.  Then the rock angle eases, pro options cease, and the rock gets crumbly.   

  A sketch fest ensues
content.protection: small cams and nuts, and a prayer

content.description: The southern most large boulder of the kingdom, and host to it's namesake aid climb.  There is no easy access to the top.     Space Lichen - 12a slab   Electric Kool-Aid Acid Test - 12a X   Acid - A3   or step/jump across the void
